page.title: 18EAST LAYTON-Village & Church
page.content: The village has no shop, the house which was the shop/post office is now a private house. A number of new detached stone built houses were erected some seven years ago and apart from one or two conversions of old stone barns in the area, these and the Council built houses at the East end of the village represent the only new developments this century. Reference is made in{Bulmers History {& Directory of North Yorkshire 1890}to {"The old hall of the Laytons,a curious {and quaint old house, with the family {arms above the door is now an inn" -} any traveller must now either quench his thirst at the Social Club or at one of the many inns a few miles away. The{church was built}between{1893 & {1895}by {R. Dodds & Sons} of{Melsonby. This {replaced } the {chapel-of-ease} "formerly used by the dissenters."
